HEDGE FUND.Definition: a type of investment fund that used risky strategies to try to make large profits

TO MAKE ENDS MEET.Definition: to have enough money to pay for basic things like food and housing

EXODUSES.Definition: movements of a large number of people leaving a place

HYPERINFLATION.Definition: a very high increase in the prices of goods and services, causing money to lose its value quickly

VIVIDLY.Definition: in a clear and detailed way

REFRESHER.Definition: reminder or something that updates us about it

DRILLED.Definition: collected by making holes in the ground

SIAMESE TWIN.Definition: one of two twins born joined together

DIVERSIFY.Definition: make diverse or composed of different elements

EMBEZZLED.Definition: stolen (for money that had been entrusted to one's care)

THE HAVES.Definition: people who had a lot of money and possessions

THE HAVE NOTS.Definition: people who did not have a lot of money or possessions

COUP.Definition: a sudden, violent, and illegal taking of power from the government

FAST FORWARD.Definition: moving quickly to a future point in time

SWORN IN.Definition: officially took an oath or made a promise to fulfil that role or duty

RHETORIC.Definition: language designed to have a persuasive or impressive effect

UNIVERSITY ENROLLMENTS.Definition: the number of students in universities

MALNUTRITION.Definition: bad health caused by having too little or not proper food

GUSHING.Definition: flowing or pouring out suddenly in large amounts

HARD-EARNED.Definition: achieved through hard work or effort

OVERVALUED.Definition: valued too highly or above its true worth

BLACK MARKET.Definition: an illegal market in which goods or currencies were bought and sold outside of the control of the government

FRAUD.Definition: deceit or trickery intended to result in financial or personal gain

MANIPULATE.Definition: handle or control to their advantage

DISCREPANCY.Definition: lack of compatibility or similarity between the two amounts

DISINCENTIVISED.Definition: made them less likely to do it by removing the motivation or desire to do it

IRONY.Definition: the fact that things were completely different to what one would expect

TENURE.Definition: period of holding his position or office

INFLATION.Definition: the general increase in prices and fall in the purchasing value of money

MALNOURISHED.Definition: suffering from lack of proper food

SANCTIONS.Definition: measures taken to force them to conform or agree to international agreements

THE NAIL IN THE COFFIN.Definition: the final event or action that led to its failure

WITHSTAND.Definition: remain undamaged or unaffected by it

WINDFALL.Definition: a large amount of money that was received unexpectedly
